39 
40 '''
41 Baxter Inverse Kinematics
42 This script can be used to send EE goals to the Baxter robot and use its internal engine for Inverse Kinematics to generate the joint's position to reach it
43 
44 rosrun baxter_examples ik_service_client2_topic.py -l left
45 rostopic pub position_sub geometry_msgs/Point "x: 0.8
46 y: 0.8
47 z: 0.03"
48 
49 '''
50 
51 global limb
52 global req_pos
53 limb="left"
54 global rs
55 def endpoint_pos_callback(data):
56  position = Point()
57  position= data.pose.position
58  #print (position)
59  pub_endpoint = rospy.Publisher('left_endpoint_pos', Point, queue_size=1)
60  pub_endpoint.publish(position)
61 
62 
63 
64 def pose_callback(data):
65 
66  '''
67  Callback to trigger the IK service
68  data is a ros message of type: geometry_msgs.msg/Point
69  '''
70  global req_pos
71  req_pos = data
72  print(req_pos)
73 
74  """ rs = baxter_interface.RobotEnable(CHECK_VERSION)
75  init_state = rs.state().enabled """
76  global rs
77  try:
78  left = baxter_interface.Gripper('left', CHECK_VERSION)
79  left.open()
80  except(rospy.ServiceException, rospy.ROSException,OSError), e:
81  return
82 
83 
84  ns = "ExternalTools/" + limb + "/PositionKinematicsNode/IKService"
85  iksvc = rospy.ServiceProxy(ns, SolvePositionIK)
86  ikreq = SolvePositionIKRequest()
87  #hdr = Header(stamp=rospy.Time.now(), frame_id='base')
88  hdr = Header(frame_id='base')
89 
90 
91  q1 = Quaternion(
92  x=0.366894936773,
93  y=0.885980397775,
94  z=0.108155782462,
95  w=0.262162481772,
96  )
97  q2 = Quaternion(
98  x=-0.36,
99  y=0.88,
100  z=0.10,
101  w=0.259,
102  )
103 
104  pose1 = PoseStamped(
105  header=hdr,
106  pose=Pose(
107  position=req_pos,
108  orientation=q1,
109  ),
110  )
111 
112  #ikreq.pose_stamp.append(poses[limb])kk
113  ikreq.pose_stamp.append(pose1)
114  try:
115  #rospy.wait_for_service(ns, 5.0)
116  rospy.wait_for_service(ns,timeout=None)
117  #time.sleep(0.00001)
118  resp = iksvc(ikreq)
119  except (rospy.ServiceException, rospy.ROSException), e:
120  rospy.logerr("Service call failed: %s" % (e,))
121  return 1
122  esit_pub = rospy.Publisher('/ik_result', String, queue_size=1)
123 
124  pub = rospy.Publisher('/robot/limb/left/joint_command', JointCommand, queue_size=1)
125 
126  resp_seeds = struct.unpack('<%dB' % len(resp.result_type),
127  resp.result_type)
128  if (resp_seeds[0] == resp.RESULT_INVALID):
129  print("Trying from an other position")
130  pubj = rospy.Publisher('/robot/limb/left/joint_command', JointCommand, queue_size=1)
131  #put joint in a decent seed position
132  jointss=JointCommand()
133  jointss.mode= 1
134  jointss.names= ["left_s0", "left_s1", "left_e0", "left_e1", "left_w0", "left_w1", "left_w2"]
135  jointss.command= [0.3202501782043669, 0.9507986021454259, -2.697083727757709, 1.662214963899674, 2.955581123794093, 1.6476877105908354, -0.19474867975667742]
136 
137  pub.publish(jointss)
138  #rospy.sleep(1)
139  time.sleep(1)
140 
141  ikreq.pose_stamp.append(pose1)
142  try:
143  #rospy.wait_for_service(ns, 5.0)
144  rospy.wait_for_service(ns,timeout=None)
145  #time.sleep(0.00001)
146  resp = iksvc(ikreq)
147  except (rospy.ServiceException, rospy.ROSException), e:
148  rospy.logerr("Service call failed: %s" % (e,))
149  return 1
150 
151  # Check if result valid, and type of seed ultimately used to get solution
152  # convert rospy's string representation of uint8[]'s to int's
153  resp_seeds = struct.unpack('<%dB' % len(resp.result_type),
154  resp.result_type)
155  if (resp_seeds[0] != resp.RESULT_INVALID):
156  seed_str = {
157  ikreq.SEED_USER: 'User Provided Seed',
158  ikreq.SEED_CURRENT: 'Current Joint Angles',
159  ikreq.SEED_NS_MAP: 'Nullspace Setpoints',
160  }.get(resp_seeds[0], 'None')
161  print("SUCCESS - Valid Joint Solution Found from Seed Type: %s" %
162  (seed_str,))
163  msg_s = String()
164  msg_s.data="SUCCESS"
165  esit_pub.publish(msg_s)
166  print "------------------"
167  print "------------------"
168  print "------------------"
169  print "joints", resp.joints[0].name
170  print "------------------"
171  print "------------------"
172  print "------------------"
173  # Format solution into Limb API-compatible dictionary
174  limb_joints = dict(zip(resp.joints[0].name, resp.joints[0].position))
175  print "\nIK Joint Solution:\n", limb_joints
176  print "------------------"
177  print "Response Message:\n", resp
178 
179  pub1 = rospy.Publisher('/robot/left_gripper_controller/joints/l_gripper_r_finger_controller/command', Float64, queue_size=1)
180  gr1=Float64()
181  gr1.data= -1
182  while pub1.get_num_connections() < 1:
183  it=1
184  pub1.publish(gr1)
185  pub2 = rospy.Publisher('/robot/left_gripper_controller/joints/l_gripper_l_finger_controller/command', Float64, queue_size=1)
186 
187  gr2=Float64()
188  gr2.data= 1
189  while pub2.get_num_connections() < 1:
190  it=1
191  pub2.publish(gr2)
192 
193 
194 
195  jointss=JointCommand()
196  jointss.mode= 1
197  jointss.names= resp.joints[0].name
198  jointss.command= resp.joints[0].position
199  while pub.get_num_connections() < 1:
200  it=1
201  # wait for a connection to publisher
202 
203  pub.publish(jointss)
204 
205  #rospy.sleep(1)
206  time.sleep(1)
207  #open gripper
208  pub1 = rospy.Publisher('/robot/left_gripper_controller/joints/l_gripper_r_finger_controller/command', Float64, queue_size=1)
209  gr1=Float64()
210  gr1.data= 0
211  while pub1.get_num_connections() < 1:
212  it=1
213  pub1.publish(gr1)
214  #close gripper
215  pub2 = rospy.Publisher('/robot/left_gripper_controller/joints/l_gripper_l_finger_controller/command', Float64, queue_size=1)
216  gr2=Float64()
217  gr2.data= 0
218  while pub2.get_num_connections() < 1:
219  it=1
220  pub2.publish(gr2)
221  else:
222  print("INVALID POSE - No Valid Joint Solution Found.")
223  msg_s = String()
224  msg_s.data="FAILED"
225  esit_pub.publish(msg_s)
226 
227 def ik_test(limb):
228  rospy.init_node("rsdk_ik_service_client")
229  rospy.Subscriber("position_sub", Point, pose_callback)
230  rospy.Subscriber("/robot/limb/left/endpoint_state", EndpointState,endpoint_pos_callback)
231  global rs
232  #enable the robot
233  rs = baxter_interface.RobotEnable()
234  rs.enable()
235  pubj = rospy.Publisher('/robot/limb/left/joint_command', JointCommand, queue_size=1)
236  #initialize joints position
237  jointss=JointCommand()
238  jointss.mode= 1
239  jointss.names= ["left_s0", "left_s1", "left_e0", "left_e1", "left_w0", "left_w1", "left_w2"]
240  jointss.command= [0.3202501782043669, 0.9507986021454259, -2.697083727757709, 1.662214963899674, 2.955581123794093, 1.6476877105908354, -0.19474867975667742]
241  #rospy.sleep(3)
242  time.sleep(3)
243 
244  pubj.publish(jointss)
245  #rospy.sleep(1)
246  time.sleep(1)
247  while 1:
248  #rospy.sleep(1)
249  time.sleep(1)
250 
251 
252 
253  return 0
254 
255 
256 def main():
257  """RSDK Inverse Kinematics
258 
259 
260  """
261  arg_fmt = argparse.RawDescriptionHelpFormatter
262  parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(formatter_class=arg_fmt,
263  description=main.__doc__)
264  parser.add_argument(
265  '-l', '--limb', choices=['left', 'right'], required=False,
266  help="the limb to test"
267  )
268  args = parser.parse_args(rospy.myargv()[1:])
269 
270 
271 
272  return ik_test(args.limb)
273 
274 if __name__ == '__main__':
275  '''
276  Baxter Inverse Kinematics
277  This script can be used to send EE goals to the Baxter robot and use its internal engine for Inverse Kinematics to generate the joint's position to reach it
278 
279  rosrun baxter_examples ik_service_client2_topic.py -l left

281  y: 0.8
282  z: 0.03"
283

285  sys.exit(main())
